title: Introducing the Emissaries
body:
Hey everyone,

Welcome to the Player Behavior board! I’d like to introduce the Emissary program.

http://i.imgur.com/xosvzga.png?noredirect

We’ve set up this group up to allow players we’ve identified as deeply knowledgeable about our behavior systems to reach out to their fellow players, providing information and helping address questions and concerns you guys bring to our attention.

Emissaries are volunteers, not Rioters, so there are some things they can't do (no pulling chat logs or lifting bans, sorry!), but they are ready and willing to help you find resources and become more familiar with Riot's player behavior policies. If you’ve been warned or banned through one of our PB&J systems (LeaverBuster, report frequency warnings, etc.) or just have a question, the Emissaries are here to work with you!

Current Emissaries are;
Sera’s Dragon
Tele
HeartVine


Q: I want to help! How can I join the Emissaries?

We’re always on the lookout for potential Emissaries, but we do so with the mentality that actions speak louder than words. If you’d like to wear the badge of an Emissary, show us that you can do it by continuing to help answer the questions of your fellow summoners in a friendly and professional manner. We’ll be watching!

Quick question, other than inside the client, where can we report bad player behavior?
I just had a 4 man team using the N word, calling people C***, being fully racist and harassing people.
The enemy team has a mid and top also behaving like that, so our chat was constantly flooded by that type of language.... and if the report in-game does nothing (which happens often) I'd like to submit this somewhere to be reviewed.

It's worth noting that Riot and Player Support will *never* give you (a 3rd party) any information about another player's account. This largely applies to the post-game reporting feature as well.

The notification that sometimes appears is meant as a bonus feel-good, not a reliable source of information. The notification not appearing, doesn't mean nothing happened. While you can guess at time bans based on match history, there is *no* way to determine if someone has been hit with a chat restriction or other punishment, so just because nothing visible to you happened, doesn't mean they weren't warned/punished.

Two other important notes:

No matter how bad the behaviour is, if it's not reported, it won't be actioned. Players ultimately decide (in the long run) what is or isn't okay, so by not reporting a behaviour, you're basically saying you think it was fine. If you forget to report a player in post-game, or couldn't for whatever reason, then you can submit that report via this page: https://support-leagueoflegends.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/360034625773

While no-tolerance behaviour falls into the category of "can escalate", it won't always. There is a significant amount of meta-data that goes into when, where, and what kind of punishment a player will receive. Even being in the game itself, we as players will never have the whole story, and so can never make perfect predictions no matter how well we know the system.

___

Now, with all that said, if you feel a post-game report was not actioned appropriately or you'd like a manual review of a particular player, you can do so via a ticket to player support: https://support-leagueoflegends.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

Again, Player Support won't give you *any* information about someone else's account, implicit or explicit, so you'll get a generic "thanks for the report" type reply.

Reports to player support also take a long time (manual reviews are much slower than what the IFS can accomplish) and they don't inform the IFS for future use, so even if you know you're going to report someone to support, still ensure you are using the post-game reporting feature as well.
